name.value: FHIR Connectathon 14 - US Core - Patient Search; format JSON

description.value: FHIR Connectathon 14 - US Core - Patient Search; resource format JSON; test a FHIR server's Patient read and search operations for various search parameter combinations: name, family, given, identifier, gender and birthdate.
Patient read and search operations
Enter a resource id for a valid Patient resource on the destination system.
Patient read operation using a known FHIR resource id on the destination system. The purpose of this test is to capture the search parameter values for the subsequent tests.
Perform the read operation for the user-defined Patient in the destination server. All search criteria parameter values are populated from this Patient resource.
Confirm that the returned HTTP status is 200(OK).
Confirm that the returned HTTP Header Content-Type contains the FHIR mime-type 'application/fhir+json'.
Confirm that the returned HTTP Header ETag is present. Warning only as the server may not support versioning.
Confirm that the returned HTTP Header Last-Modified is present. Warning only as the server may not support versioning.
Confirm that the returned HTTP Header Location is present. Warning only as this is optional but servers are encouraged to return this.

Confirm that the returned Patient conforms to the base FHIR specification.
Confirm that the resource version is present. Warning only as the server may not support versioning.
